column4: hi!  anybody that could help me debug why network-manager fails to connect to a non-encrypted network?
Make sure that the network you want to connect to is supported, as in the correct frequency
come again?
You are using wlan, right?
by default, yes, since that's what n-m loads.
however, it really is atheros
It shows that you are connected to the network, or no
connection works fine if I manually configure everything via terminal, including selecting an AP using iwconfig
it's only n-m that fails. or at least the applet does
I assume you are using the default Ubuntu NM, right? Not NDISwrapper?
not ndiswrapper.  wlan (which in turns gets the atheros driver from madwifi)
Hmmm...I've never seen that problem your having.  You played around with the configs, right?  Also, make sure to disable any other network connections
if I try to connect to an encrypted ap, I _immediaely_ get the dialogue asking me for the WAP or WEP info.
But with Un encrypted, it just hangs?
but if I try to connect to an non-encrypted AP, it hangs forever, then reports failure
Can you connect to the AP on another machine?  Maybe its not allowing you to connect because of securty settings
it gets worse:  the n-m daemon from dapper even failed getting a connection on the fixed interface.  the one from dapper gets AND keeps an IP it gets from a DHCP server.
erm.. te one from edgy at least works with a fixed NIC
Ok, then its the network manager.  Try re-installing it, your problem is kinda new for me.  Sorry. :(
I dubt it's prventing me from connecting per-se, since as I said, it works from commandline
Perhaps you can create a script that auto-connects for your and just add it to start at boot
not really.  I mostly use wireless to access public netwokrs as a roamer
I see, I guess I cant really help you there.  All I can really suggest then is to try and reinstall the NM
